version_description:
Fix a bug that could cause gaps in tracking.

New in version 1.1:

- Daily notification. A mid-morning notification telling you how far you went yesterday. You can turn these off if you don't want them -- but we think you might come to rely on them like we have. This is a free update.

- Calorie tracking. We used the latest research to build in calorie tracking that's personalized to you, how far, and how fast you walk. Available as an in-app purchase.

- A number of bug fixes and performance improvements.

- Design refinements including subtler buttons.

Fix a bug that could cause gaps in tracking.

New in version 1.1:

- Daily notification. A mid-morning notification telling you how far you went yesterday. You can turn these off if you don't want them -- but we think you might come to rely on them like we have. This is a free update.

- Calorie tracking. We used the latest research to build in calorie tracking that's personalized to you, how far, and how fast you walk. Available as an in-app purchase.

- A number of bug fixes and performance improvements.

- Design refinements including subtler buttons.

Bugfixes and (major) performance improvements. If you have an iPhone 5s, 6 or 6 Plus, this update should greatly improve the speed and reliability of tracking.

We've got lots of cool stuff we're working on in the lab, and if this update gets you working smoothly we'd love to hear about it. A positive rating or review is a quick way to show your support and helps us keep working away. Thanks!

***EXTRA: We are looking for a few more beta testers for new Steps features. Dedicated walker? Want to try the latest and greatest? Email us at beta@yearofcode.com to apply.

Bugfixes and (major) performance improvements. If you have an iPhone 5s, 6 or 6 Plus, this update should greatly improve the speed and reliability of tracking.

We've got lots of cool stuff we're working on in the lab, and if this update gets you working smoothly we'd love to hear about it. A positive rating or review is a quick way to show your support and helps us keep working away. Thanks!

***EXTRA: We are looking for a few more beta testers for new Steps features. Dedicated walker? Want to try the latest and greatest? Email us at beta@yearofcode.com to apply.

Now you can use Steps from your wrist with our new Apple Watch app. Check how many steps you've taken, distance, walking time and progress towards your goal!

We've also added a Today widget. Add it to Notification Center and check your steps and goal progress almost instantly!

Of course, what would an update be without some "bug fixes and performance improvements?" The big one is faster updating for most iPhone 5s and 6 users. We've also improved updating of walking time and calories.

We've got lots more on the way soon! If you enjoy Steps or it's helping you become more active, please take a moment to leave a review or rating in the App Store. We're a small company, and positive reviews make a huge difference to us, and are a big help in spreading the word.

Now you can use Steps from your wrist with our new Apple Watch app. Check how many steps you've taken, distance, walking time and progress towards your goal!

We've also added a Today widget. Add it to Notification Center and check your steps and goal progress almost instantly!

Of course, what would an update be without some "bug fixes and performance improvements?" The big one is faster updating for most iPhone 5s and 6 users. We've also improved updating of walking time and calories.

We've got lots more on the way soon! If you enjoy Steps or it's helping you become more active, please take a moment to leave a review or rating in the App Store. We're a small company, and positive reviews make a huge difference to us, and are a big help in spreading the word.
Bug fixes
Bug fixes

Under the hood, Steps is brand new! We’ve updated lots of the nuts and bolts to pave the way for new features. And we’ve included tons of bug fixes and other updates.

If you have an Apple Watch, Steps has a brand new watch app
- Complications for your favorite watch face
- Track your steps even when you don’t have your phone on you
- Steps on both your watch and phone will show a merged view of your walking as measured by your phone and your watch

This version also has a new, improved widget with more info and an updated look.

Bug fixes, including an important fix for new users on iOS 12

Further bugfixes...

Hello, there! Now you can customize Steps and make it your own with themes! Choose from six gorgeous new themes and watch the colors light up in a new way as you walk.

Also, a number of bug fixes, including improvements to the VoiceOver experience.
Further bugfixes...

Hello, there! Now you can customize Steps and make it your own with themes! Choose from six gorgeous new themes and watch the colors light up in a new way as you walk.

Also, a number of bug fixes, including improvements to the VoiceOver experience.

This update includes bugfixes, including some visual bugs while your step count is updating.
For new users, Steps can now automatically set your height, weight and so on from Apple Health, if you give it permission to. And under the hood, there's some groundwork for the next update -- stay tuned :)

This update includes bugfixes, including some visual bugs while your step count is updating.
For new users, Steps can now automatically set your height, weight and so on from Apple Health, if you give it permission to. And under the hood, there's some groundwork for the next update -- stay tuned :)

This update includes more responsive tracking and more.

- Faster updating of your step count while the app is open (yay!)
- Improved daily summary notifications
- Fixes for delayed or missing updates on main screen or in your history view
- Other misc fixes

This update includes more responsive tracking and more.

New year, new features! Steps can now send you a new kind of progress update: a few notifications during the day to let you know how far you've walked.
- Don't want those? Tap the settings icon, tap Notifications and choose exactly which you'd like to receive

This release also contains many bug fixes:
- Fix for some uncommon crashing bugs
- No longer asks for Health permissions on every launch if you tap 'Skip'
- Improvements to tracking reliability and background updates
- Fix tracking for devices that don't support Motion Activity (e.g. iPhone 5) but have other apps that write step data to Health
- Other misc bug fixes

Continual improvement!

- This version offers much better performance and reliability of the widget (widgets are the things you can add to your notification center)
- Miscellaneous bugfixes and performance improvements

In this update:
- New navigation: tabs, no more scrolling up to find your History! We hope this change makes it easier to use Steps.
- Improved experience when you first install Steps
- Bug fixes

New: Redesigned and expanded History view!
- Yearly, monthly and weekly activity summaries
- Scroll through and compare all your activity at a glance
- Swipe a day or a week at a time through the detailed view

Love it? Hate it? We'd like to hear from you. Tap the settings icon at upper left, then tap Get Help and send us a message.

Also:
- Lots of other bugfixes
- Layout improvements for 38mm and 40mm Apple Watches

This version adds hourly charts in History:
- Tap the History tab, then tap a day to view details
- Scrub over the chart to see hour-by-hour activity

Also:
- Improved VoiceOver experience when viewing details in History
- Bugfixes

Bugfixes & performance improvements.

We're also working on expanding our beta tester program. 
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Bugfixes & performance improvements.

We're also working on expanding our beta tester program. 
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Happy new year from Steps! We hope your year is off to a great start :)

We've got a big Watch app update for you:
- New complications for your watch faces: every type and size are now available
- The watch ring and complications follow your chosen theme
- Graph of the day's activity
- Big speed and reliability improvements
- Works independently of our iOS app
- This update requires watchOS 6

There are some iOS app updates, too:

- A bunch of bugfixes, especially if you use larger text sizes
- The History tab now starts zoomed in to the current week -- tap back to zoom out and see months or years

Also, we continue to expand our beta tester program.
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Happy new year from Steps! We hope your year is off to a great start :)

We've got a big Watch app update for you:
- New complications for your watch faces: every type and size are now available
- The watch ring and complications follow your chosen theme
- Graph of the day's activity
- Big speed and reliability improvements
- Works independently of our iOS app
- This update requires watchOS 6

There are some iOS app updates, too:

- A bunch of bugfixes, especially if you use larger text sizes
- The History tab now starts zoomed in to the current week -- tap back to zoom out and see months or years

Also, we continue to expand our beta tester program.
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Introducing Workouts!

Going for a walk? Now you can track just that walk (or a part of your day) and:
- Set a goal of step count, distance, or time
- Get notifications as you make progress towards your goal
- Use GPS to record where you went on a map
- Record more detailed data
- Sync your workouts to Apple Health

We hope you'll love using this new part of the app. If you need help or have any feedback, please tap the settings icon at upper left, then tap Get Help and send us a message.

This version also includes a number of bugfixes, smaller improvements and behind-the-scenes updates.

Finally, we continue to expand our beta tester program.
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Walk on!

Walk on!

You can now record workouts from your Apple Watch! No need to bring your phone.
Live tracking with maps, progress charts and goal progress.
When you're done, view on your phone in the History or Workout tabs.
Fully synced with Apple Health.

We hope you've been able to stay safe and healthy these last few months.
Walking can be a physically distanced activity and a lot of us have been walking more lately. (We certainly have!)
Please remember to follow your local guidelines when you're out, and hang in there.

We continue to expand our beta tester program. If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Support for iOS 14 is here!

Two new widgets: see your daily progress and stats at a glance, or view your latest workout and quickly start a new workout.

Also:
- Steps now keeps your body measurements in sync with Apple Health (with your permission), for accurate calculations
- Improved experience on Apple Watch when using VoiceOver
- Workout finish reminder. Forget to finish your workout? After you stop, you'll get a reminders
- Many other small improvements and fixes

Bugfixes and internal improvements.

In particular, this version fixes a crash for long-time Steps users that could occur when browsing History.

In particular, this version fixes a crash for long-time Steps users that could occur when browsing History.

Bugfixes and internal improvements.

Fixes include:
- an issue that could prevent changing your goal in our Watch app
- a rare issue that could prevent our in-app purchase from being recognized.

We also continue to expand our beta tester program.
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

Happy 2021! In this update:

Some improvements to workouts:
- You can now give your workouts a name, record how it felt, and keep notes. Just tap edit after finishing your workout.
- The Workout tab now shows all your workouts, not just the most recent.

Bugfixes and internal improvements.

We also continue to expand our beta tester program.
If you'd like to help test new versions of Steps, please send a message to beta@yearofcode.com and let us know!

In this update are a number of little improvements and fixes. Sometimes it's the little things :)

Here are a few:
- Summaries in the History tab now show calories if available
- In certain timezones (for example in British Summer Time), you might have encountered weird behavior when scrolling your history by week. That's fixed now.
- An issue that could cause a couple of our Watch complications to display gigantic, implausible step counts is now fixed.

And much much more. Thanks for using Steps!

In this update are a number of little improvements and fixes. Sometimes it's the little things :)

Here are a few:
- Summaries in the History tab now show calories if available
- In certain timezones (for example in British Summer Time), you might have encountered weird behavior when scrolling your history by week. That's fixed now.
- An issue that could cause a couple of our Watch complications to display gigantic, implausible step counts is now fixed.

And much much more. Thanks for using Steps!

In this version:
- We've improved and modernized the way your activity data is processed for faster, more consistent updating
- We updated our algorithm for estimating walking time, and you might notice improved accuracy
- Steps now requires iOS 13 or greater
- Our watchOS app can once again be used without giving Steps permission to read from Apple Health! It will show just the activity measured while wearing your watch. (With Apple Health permissions, it will instead show the merged total from your watch and phone).
- And of course, there are other fixes and improvements throughout the app.

Thanks for using Steps!

In this version:
- We've improved and modernized the way your activity data is processed for faster, more consistent updating
- We updated our algorithm for estimating walking time, and you might notice improved accuracy
- Steps now requires iOS 13 or greater
- Our watchOS app can once again be used without giving Steps permission to read from Apple Health! It will show just the activity measured while wearing your watch. (With Apple Health permissions, it will instead show the merged total from your watch and phone).
- And of course, there are other fixes and improvements throughout the app.

Thanks for using Steps!
